doc: ['The city and the car .', 'The social science have generally ignored the motor car and its awesome consequence for social life , especially in their analysis of the urban .', "Urban study in particular has failed to consider the overwhelming impact of the automobile in transforming the time-space 'scapes ' of the modern urban/suburban dweller .", 'Focusing on form of mobility into , across and through the city , we consider how the car reconfigures urban life , involving distinct way of dwelling , travelling and socializing in , and through , an automobilized time-space .', "We trace urban sociology 's paradoxical resistance to culture of mobility , and argue that civil society should be reconceptualized as a 'civil society of automobility ' .", 'We then explore how automobility makes instantaneous time and the negotiation of extensive space central to how social life is configured .', 'As people dwell in and socially interact through their car , they become hyphenated car-drivers : at home in movement , transcending distance to complete a series of activity within fragmented moment of time .', 'Urban social life has always entailed various mobility but the car transforms these in a distinct combination of flexibility and coercion .', 'Automobility is a complex amalgam of interlocking machine , social practice and way of dwelling which have reshaped citizenship and the public sphere via the mobilization of modern civil society .', "In the conclusion we trace a vision of an evolved automobility for the city of tomorrow in which public space might again be made 'public ' .", 'Typhoid fever in child aged less than 5 year .', 'Background .', 'Calculation of the incidence of typhoid fever during preschool year is important to define the optimum age of immunisation and the choice of vaccine for public-health programme in developing country .', 'Hospital-based study have suggested that child younger than 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever , but this view needs to be re-examined in community-based longitudinal study .', 'We undertook a prospective follow-up study of resident of a low-income urban area of Delhi , India , with active surveillance for case detection .', 'Method .', 'A baseline census was undertaken in 1995 .', 'Between Nov 1 , 1995 , and Oct 31 , 1996 , we visited 8172 resident of 1820 household in Kalkaji , Delhi , twice weekly to detect febrile case .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding .', '63 culture-positive typhoid fever case were detected .', 'Of these , 28 ( 44 % ) were in child aged under 5 year .', 'The incidence rate of typhoid per 1000 person-years was 27.3 at age under 5 year , 11.7 at 5-19 year , and 1.1 between 19 and 40 year .', 'The difference in the incidence of typhoid fever between those under 5 year and those aged 5-19 year ( 15.6 per 1000 person-years [ 95 % CI 4.7-26.5 ] ) , and those aged 19-40 year ( 26.2 [ 16.0-36.3 ] ) was significant ( p < 0.001 far both ) .', 'The difference between the incidence of typhoid at 5-19 year and the incidence at 19-40 year was also significant ( 10.6 [ 6.3-14.8 ] , p < 0 001 ) .', 'Morbidity in those under 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and need for hospital admission .', 'Interpretation .', 'Our finding challenge the common view that typhoid fever is a disorder of school-age child and of adult .', 'Typhoid is a common and significant cause of morbidity between 1 and 5 year of age .', 'The optimum age of typhoid immunisation and the choice of vaccine need to be reassessed.This study was conducted to measure the incidence of typhoid fever among preschooler .', 'It was suggested that child aged 5 year do not need vaccination against typhoid fever .', 'However , it is important to re-examine this view , particularly in infant and young child in the low-income urban area of Delhi , India , through active surveillance .', 'Blood sample were obtained from febrile patient , and those who tested positive for Salmonella typhi were treated with ciprofloxacin .', 'Finding revealed 63 culture-positive typhoid fever case , about 44 % of which were in child under 5 year of age .', 'Morbidity in child under age 5 and in older people was similar in term of duration of fever , sign and symptom , and the need for hospital admission .', 'The incidence of typhoid fever and the age distribution of the case varied between developing country .', 'Thus , the age pattern of typhoid fever observed in the urban study area may differ in rural area within India or in other developing country .', 'A reevaluation of the optimum age and vaccine of choice is needed .', "Making friend in Zurich 's urban forest and park : The role of public green space for social inclusion of youth from different culture .", 'Integrating the distinct culture of foreign resident youth is a challenge for Swiss political and educational institution .', 'An empirical survey of pupil ( n = 437 ) and teacher in selected school of the city and metropolitan area of Zurich investigated leisure activity in urban forest and public green space for their potential to facilitate social interaction between Swiss and immigrant young people .', 'Pattern of socialising and making friend in these outdoor location were found to differ depending on age , school level , gender and the percentage of immigrant in each residential area .', 'Public urban green space were found to play an important role for child and youth in making contact and friend across culture , which is considered a prerequisite for social inclusion .', 'Social impact assessment and public participation in China : A case study of land requisition in Guangzhou .', "This study examines the current prospect for and obstacle facing the implementation of social impact assessment ( SIA ) and participatory planning in the People 's Republic of China .", 'During the past two decade , rapid urbanisation and the conversion of rural land for urban development have led to numerous social conflict and tension between the Chinese government and its people .', 'SIA and public participation in development decision have received increasing attention from the Chinese authority as possible way to tackle the problem .', 'Based on a Guangzhou case study , this paper argues that the assessment and mitigation of adverse impact on the community from urban development have been carried out with different objective , core value and principle when compared with those in Western society .', 'It concludes that the poor prospect of SIA and collaborative planning in China lie not only in the weak framework for environmental legislation , but also in all institution concerning state-society relation , the socialist governing ideology and traditional Chinese culture .', 'Revanchist sanitisation or coercive care ?', 'The use of enforcement to combat begging , street drinking and rough sleeping in England .', "This paper examines recent response to 'problematic street culture ' in England , where increasing pressure has been exerted to prevent people from begging and street drinking in public space , with rough sleeping also targeted in some area .", "Drawing upon in-depth interview with enforcement agent , support provider and targeted individual , it assesses the extent to which the strategy employed are indicative of a 'revanchist expulsion ' of the deviant Other and/or an expression of 'coercive care ' for the vulnerable Other .", 'It concludes that , whilst the recent development appear , at first glance , to be symptomatic of revanchist sanitisation of public space , closer examination reveals that the situation is actually much more complex than a revanchist reading of the situation might suggest , and perhaps not as devoid of compassion .', 'Defining Suburbs .', 'There is no consensus as to what exactly constitutes a suburb .', 'This article examines the range of suburban definition in term of their structure and the topical issue that they grapple with .', 'Suburb have been defined according to many different dimension from location and transportation mode to culture and physical appearance .', 'Given this confusion , one approach is to abandon the term ; another is to use it with greater precision .', 'This is more than just an issue of semantics .', 'Rather how people talk and think about suburb shape how they can see such area being developed and redeveloped in the future .', 'Moving young life : Mobility , immobility and inter-generational tension in urban Africa .', "This paper explores young people 's experience and perception of mobility and mobility constraint in poorer urban area of Ghana , Malawi and South Africa within the specific context of inter-generational relation .", "Drawing principally on qualitative research finding from a study involving both adult and child researcher , our aim is to chart the diversity and commonality of urban young people 's mobility experience in the everyday - how they use and experience the city - developing a comparative perspective across three urban study site which links young people 's mobility with the power relation that operate to shape their movement in individual location .", "In particular , we consider how positive and negative image of young people 's mobility play out in term of the inter-generational friction and negotiation generated by their mobility performance .", "We also reflect on the developmental implication , in term of young people 's access to service and income and their participation in the social network and peer culture which may shape their life trajectory .", 'Three theme are explored in detail : mobility as challenge , mobility as temptation and mobility control .', 'Greater Portland : Urban life and landscape in the Pacific Northwest .', 'It has been called one of the nation ’ s most livable region , ranked among the best managed city in America , hailed as a top spot to work , and favored as a great place to do business , enjoy the art , pursue outdoor recreation , and make one ’ s home .', 'Indeed , year of cooperative urban planning between developer and those interested in ecology and habitability have transformed Portland from a provincial western city into an exemplary American metropolis .', 'Its thriving downtown , its strong neighborhood , and its pioneering effort at local management have brought a steady procession of journalist , scholar , and civic leader to investigate the “ Portland style ” that values dialogue and consensus , treats politics as a civic duty , and assumes that it is possible to work toward public good .', 'Probing behind the press clipping , acclaimed urban historian Carl Abbott examines the character of contemporary Portland-its people , politics , and public life-and the region ’ s history and geography in order to discover how Portland has achieved its reputation as one of the most progressive and livable city in the United States and to determine whether typical pressure of urban growth are pushing Portland back toward the national norm .', 'In Greater Portland , Abbott argues that the city can not be understood without reference to its place .', 'Its river , hill , and broader regional setting have shaped the economy and the cityscape .', 'Portlanders are Oregonians , Northwesteners , Cascadians ; they value their city as much for where it is as for what it is , and this powerful sense of place nurtures a distinctive civic culture .', 'Tracing the way in which Portlanders have talked and thought about their city , Abbott reveals the tension between their diverse vision of the future and plan for development .', 'Most citizen of Portland desire a balance between continuity and change , one that supports urban progress but actively monitors its effect on the region ’ s expansive green space and on the community ’ s culture .', 'This strong civic participation in city planning and politics is what gives greater Portland its unique character , a positive setting for class integration , neighborhood revitalization , and civic value .', 'The result , Abbott confirms , is a region whose unique initiative remain a model of American urban planning .', 'Natural disaster and nuclear crisis in Japan : Response and recovery after Japan ’ s 3/11 .', 'The March 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan plunged the country into a state of crisis .', 'As the nation struggled to recover from a record breaking magnitude 9 earthquake and a tsunami that was as high as thirty-eight meter in some place , news trickled out that Fukushima had experienced meltdown in three reactor .', 'These tragic catastrophe claimed some 20,000 life , initially displacing some 500,000 people and overwhelming Japan ’ s formidable disaster preparedness.This book brings together the analysis and insight of a group of distinguished expert on Japan to examine what happened , how various institution and actor responded and what lesson can be drawn from Japan ’ s disaster .', 'The contributor , many of whom experienced the disaster first hand , assess the wide–ranging repercussion of this catastrophe and how it is already reshaping Japanese culture , politics , energy policy , and urban planning .', 'Brain culture : Shaping policy through neuroscience .', 'This unique book offers a timely analysis of the impact of rapidly advancing knowledge about the brain , mind and behaviour on contemporary public policy and practice .', 'Examining development in behaviour change policy , neuroscience , architecture and urban design , education , and workplace training programmes the book analyses the global spread of research agenda , policy experiment and everyday practice informed by ‘ brain culture ’ .It offers an alternative , geographically informed set of explanation for what matter in explaining how people behave and how citizen ’ behaviour should be governed .', 'It will be of interest to student and academic across the social and behavioural science .', 'Intellectual of empire : Eric Dutton and hegemony in British Africa .', 'This essay examines the career of Eric Dutton in five British African colony from 1919 to 1952 , with case study of his work in Lusaka and Zanzibar .', "In analyzing Dutton 's career , I use a Gramscian conception of the role of intellectual in creating colonial hegemony , against the backdrop of recent research on the relationship of geography to colonial discourse .", "Dutton worked and corresponded with key player in Britain 's African empire .", 'He was a major force behind early urban-planning program in East and Central Africa and author of four geographical book .', 'Permanently disabled by war wound , he was also permanently infatuated with the moral rightness of British imperial culture .', "A concern for geography 's professional relationship with , and the geographical legacy of , colonialism has emerged in recent scholarship on Africa , largely through study of travel writing , fiction , and nineteenth- or early twentieth-century exploration geography .", "Later scholar-officials like Dutton sought to apply their knowledge to the shaping of space to serve the Empire 's direct and immediate need in Africa , even while trying to win the heart and mind of its subject people .", "Around Timothy Mitchell 's ( 1988 ) concept of `` enframing , '' I build an analysis of the spatial project with which Dutton is most associated and show how Lusaka and Zanzibar were enframed by his plan .", 'Through his publication and correspondence , as well as his seemingly omnipresent service , Dutton has an important legacy that has neither been articulated nor analyzed , one which points to the importance of contextualized biography for analysis of colonial discourse .', 'I argue here for seeing Dutton as an intellectual in the service of colonial hegemony and its enframing spatial discourse , although the character of his agency exemplifies why that attempted hegemony failed .', "'China 's leading historical and cultural city ' : Branding Dali City through public-private partnership in Bai architecture revitalization .", 'Competing with other Chinese city for investment and tourism , various governmental body with jurisdiction in Dali City have begun to make use of local historical and cultural asset in order to brand the city .', 'This paper aims to reveal how partnership between the public and private sector in heritage management have functioned as an approach to city branding , and how local people perceive and are influenced by these partnership .', "Applying perspective from the scholarly literature on city branding and public-private partnership , this paper examines two case in Dali City - Zhang 's Garden and the Linden Center - to detail how local government and elite entrepreneur have partnernered in support of Bai architecture revitalization with tourism in mind .", 'This paper also considers opinion from the local general public regarding these partnership , and investigates the complex relationship among local government , elite entrepreneur , and the public .', 'Uncovering inconspicuous place using social medium check-in and street view image .', 'There is a Chinese proverb , “ if your wine taste really good , you do not need to worry about the location of your bar ( 酒香不怕巷子深 ) ” , which implies that the popular place for local resident are sometimes hidden behind an unassuming door or on unexpected street .', 'Discovering these unassuming place ( e.g .', 'restaurant ) of a city will benefit the understanding of local culture and help to build livable neighborhood .', 'Previous work has been limited by the lack of appropriate data source and efficient tool to evaluate the popularity , ambiance and physical surroundings of place in large-scale urban area .', 'In addition , how to characterize place with respect to different group of people remains unclear .', 'In this work , we propose a data-driven approach using social medium check-in and street-level image to compare the different activity pattern of visitor and local , and uncover inconspicuous but interesting place for them in a city .', 'We use check-in record as a proxy of the popularity of a particular type of place , and differentiate visitor and local based on their travel and social medium behavior .', 'In addition , we employ street-level image to represent the physical environment of place .', 'As a result , we discovered a number of inconspicuous yet popular restaurant in Beijing .', 'These restaurant are located mostly in deep alley of Old Beijing neighborhood , where the physical environment are not particularly appealing ; however , these place are frequently visited by local for social engagement .', 'We also discovered beautiful but unpopular outdoor place in Beijing .', 'These place are potential recreational area for all group of people and could be improved regarding urban design and planning to make these public infrastructure more attractive .', 'This work demonstrates how multi-source big geo-data can be combined to build comprehensive place-based representation for different group of people .', 'Key concept in event management .', 'In recent year we have seen an enormous growth of festival and event activity and the literature within the field is consequently huge .', 'In order to make sense of this rapid and dynamic development , student are dependent on a book that can lead them through the myriad of theoretical framework offered.This book naturally situates itself in the middle of this need , offering a comprehensive and illuminating account of the festival and event field .', 'Written with academic rigour yet accessible at the same time , Quinn proves herself to be an outstanding communicator and stimulator of knowledge.International in content and timely in its up to date coverage of key topic , this will be an invaluable reference source for student from Event Management , Tourism and Leisure study .', 'It will also be of great use for student from Business Studies , Marketing , Cultural Studies and Geography.The SAGE Key Concepts SeriesRecent volume include : Key Concepts in Youth StudiesMark Cieslik and Donald SimpsonKey Concepts in Hospitality ManagementEdited by Roy C. D. Kremer , Aidan Moran , Graham Walker and Cathy CraigFifty Key Concepts in Gender StudiesJane Pilcher and Imelda WhelehanThe SAGE Key Concepts series provides student with accessible and authoritative knowledge of the essential topic in a variety of discipline .', 'Cross-referenced throughout , the format encourages critical evaluation through understanding .', "Enquiry concerning reproduction
