Capital 119Social Function 123Social Impacts 126Sponsorship 131Sports Event 135Stakeholders 139Sustainable Event 144Tourism 149Volunteering 154Conclusion 159References 163About the AuthorBernadette Quinn has a PhD in Human Geography from University College Dublin .", 'She currently lectures and research in the Department of Tourism at the Dublin Institute of Technology .', 'The nature and meaning of festival and festivity in contemporary society is one of her key research interest and her work on the topic has been published in a number of international journal including Urban Studies , Social and Cultural Geography , Tourism Geographies , Event Management and the Journal of Policy Research in Tourism , Leisure and Event .', 'Other research interest include the relationship between culture and tourism , leisure and social inclusion and contemporary form of tourism mobility .', 'Publication on these topic have appeared in the Annals of Tourism Research , Gender , Place and Culture and Leisure Studies as well as in various edited book collection .', 'Her teaching interest mirror her research interest and she is involved in undergraduate and postgraduate tourism management and event management programme teaching module related to cultural tourism , international festival environment , tourism study , and tourism and event policy.AcknowledgementsMy long-standing interest in festival and event has been shaped by many people , both practitioner and academic , over the year .', 'These people are too many to mention by name , but I owe all of them a debt of gratitude .', 'While writing this book I was very fortunate to be able to draw on the expertise of colleague , particularly Lucy Horan and Ruth Craggs , as well as the support and encouragement of my other colleague at the Dublin Institute of Technology .', 'Finally , a huge thank you to John , Muireann and Aoife for absolutely everything.IntroductionIn 1991 , Getz wrote that festival and holiday event represented nouveau , alternative tourism ( cited in Lee et al.', ', 2008 ) .', 'How time have changed !', 'Such an assertion is simply unimaginable today when , more than 20 year later , finding a city or town without at least one annual festival or planned event would be quite a challenge .', 'Does this constitute progress ?', 'How do festival and event contribute to contemporary society ?', 'What has the remarkable rise in festival and event meant for the development of tourism destination ; for the development of economy , be they local , national or international ?', 'These and many other question preoccupy what is now an extremely large , international community of scholar from a range of discipline who adopt a variety of research approach to study the complex and profoundly important communal celebration at the heart of the diverse festival and event treated in this volume.While it is difficult to calculate the size of festival and event activity , academic , policy and industry commentator everywhere concur that its recent growth across the world in term of number , diversity and popularity has been enormous ( Getz , 1991 ; Finkel , 2009 ; Thrane , 2002 ) .', 'In the USA it is estimated that there were 10,000 festival per year , attracting over 31 million visitor by the mid-1990s ( Janiskee , 1996 ; TIA , 2004 ) .', 'In Australia , the government notes that festival have become ubiquitous , with hundred being held every year ( Australian Government , 2012 ) .', 'In Europe , the growth has been similarly dramatic .', 'According to the International Festival and Event Association ( IFEA ) , the special event industry is estimated to comprise between 4 and 5 million regularly occurring event ( Wood , 2012 ) .', 'This significant growth in the practice of festival and event brought a parallel increase in the emergence and development of the festival and event management profession .', 'It soon also brought a rise in academic interest : closely allied to the development of tourism study , academic began to take an interest in charting development in the sector and the literature has burgeoned over the last 20 year .', 'Much of the research is published in tourism study and specific event-oriented journal , but it also finds expression in a wide range of journal dedicated to management and marketing , urban and place study , art and cultural policy , as well as many social sciences-oriented journal .', 'In the majority of case , festival and special event are presented as broadly positive phenomenon .', 'Throughout the literature , opening paragraphs emphasise the important role they play in advancing local and regional economy , branding place , attracting visitor , extending the tourism season and fostering community spirit .', 'Yet , festival and special event , the subject matter at the heart of this book represent a very substantial , complex and dynamic set of activity that can be both deeply rooted and rapidly changing in country throughout the world .', 'In academia , they are studied from diverse management , social science and humanity perspective .', 'As such , interpretation of their impact and contribution to contemporary economy and society as well as approach to valuing , managing and shaping appropriate policy for their advancement are multiple and at time conflicting.The literature in the field is now enormous and growing all the time .', 'Increasing familiarity with the literature brings an increasing awareness of the unevenness of knowledge , the fracture between academic discipline and the continuous emergence of new sub-fields .', 'The literature on the Olympic Games , for example , is now in and of itself very substantial , yet the extent to which knowledge generated on this particular event translates across into the study of other event that differ by scale and type is very unclear .', 'Getz and Andersson ( 2010 ) explained that festival tourism has been studied by many researcher from many perspective : impact ( of varying type ) , place marketing , travel pattern , displacement effect , motivation , market segmentation , quality and satisfaction , regional development , relationship to urban renewal and development , and link to culture and community .', 'However , this sector is nothing if not dynamic and while knowledge gap are closing in some area , they continue to open up elsewhere all the time .', 'This book tries to take cognisance of this dynamism in including concept that would seem very important in term of future development .', "The concept of ‘ risk management ' , so important from an applied perspective , and that of ‘ emerging economy ' , so important from a geographical perspective , are two example of this.This volume is tasked with introducing , defining and reviewing the current state of knowledge of the key concept in the contemporary study of festival and event .", 'While this involves reviewing literature that is either part of , or closely associated with , tourism study , in reality , it is a multi-disciplinary task that draws on a wide breadth of discipline area .', 'It is well recognised that festival and special event are important from community , social , cultural , political and economic perspective .', 'Despite the growth and popularity of festival and special event , researcher were initially slow in directing research beyond economic impact and motivation ( Gursoy et al.', ', 2004 ) .', 'However , this imbalance is now being corrected .', 'The recent evolution of the academic study of festival and event can not be understood in isolation from the simultaneous evolution of the academic study of tourism .', 'As theme of enquiry have emerged and developed within tourism study , they virtually always evolve into a new theme of enquiry within festival and event study .', 'This link between the two area of study is very strong , with tourism study the primary field of enquiry and festival and event a large and distinct sub-field within.The task of advancing knowledge about the meaning , practice and policy associated with festival and event remains ongoing .', 'As this volume will show , the understanding of core concept remains uneven , and our knowledge of certain dimension of festival and event activity far exceeds that of others .', 'Some of the extant gap are recent , emerging only when contemporary political and societal debate begin to highlight particular concern .', 'The concept of innovation is a case in point : question as to the role that the festival and event sector plays in promoting , adopting and managing innovation are now coming to the fore in the literature .', "Others , such as the sustainability of the sector 's activity have been an issue for longer .", 'Most recently of all , the question as to how festival and event activity are affected by global recession has begun to be investigated , in response to the harsh reality negatively affecting the health of the sector in very recent time .', 'The 35 concept that are discussed in this volume are laid out in alphabetical order .', 'Toronto and Vancouver bound : The location choice of new Canadian immigrant .', 'Ethnic clustering plays an important role in the location choice of new immigrant to Canada .', 'A concentration of people in the same geographic area who are of similar ethnic background , culture and language can be an important source of financial and personal support , information and guidance , and social more .', 'Evidence is found that , after controlling for a range of other observable and unobservable factor important to the location decision , the concentration of people of a particular ethnic group in a particular area has a significant effect on the chance that new immigrant of the same ethnic group will choose to live there .', 'The size of the effect , however , depends on the personal characteristic of immigrant .', 'The attraction of ethnic concentration of immigrant is significantly smaller for new immigrant with a university degree and for those who normally speak English at home .', 'Characteristic of the local ethnic community related to education and language profile are also significant determinant of location choice .', 'Scale , regime , and the urban governance of Glasgow .', 'Over the last two decade , urban regime theory has become one of the most dominant paradigms of thought in urban study .', 'In particular , regime theory offers a complex account of urban governance , or how local government , the business community , and community organization gain the capacity to shape the policy that affect city , that is , govern .', 'Although regime theory is a dominant theory in urban study , it does , nevertheless , have its share of detractor , and one criticism has been its failure to take into account geographical scale .', 'While there is an acknowledgment in urban regime theory of wider economic process , such as the broad transformation in international and national trade , investment , finance , etc.', ', or the role played by federal or state government , the bias has remained mostly local , particularly in regard to urban governance .', 'In urban regime theory literature the policy and action of international and national institution either nicely conjoin with local interest or are nearly totally absent .', 'Due to this oversight , urban regime theory tends to underemphasize how the capacity to govern a city effectively is sometimes the result of the interaction of action of people at multiple scale .', 'This article attempts to address this oversight in an analysis of Glasgow , Scotland , during the 1980s .', 'By focusing on the role of the European City of Culture in the revitalization of the city , this article demonstrates how the capacity for a ruling coalition to transform the city and to govern effectively was the consequence of the policy and administrative action undertaken at other geographical scale .', 'The governance of homelessness in the European South : Spatial and institutional contexts of philanthrophy in Athens .', 'This paper aims at shedding some light , by contrasting the discourse and practice of shelter-providers and welfare agency which manage the homeless in Athens , on the way in which culture and power combine to produce segmented response to homelessness in the European South .', 'It is argued that central state , local state , church and voluntary agency resort to different understanding of pity in order to acknowledge responsibility for different group of homeless people and shape action in a variety of local setting .', "Official rhetoric address visible homelessness but conceals exclusion , selecting deserving from non-deserving client and 'clean-ups ' of public space .", 'Radical voice aim at revealing hidden homelessness and sustain inclusive practice such as street or community work , but they fail to secure access for the homeless to housing , income and good quality of care .', 'Street and social life in city : a taxonomy of sociability .', 'Evident in the urban revival of North American city are planning and design strategy focused on attracting the downtown worker , the tourist , the conventioneer and the newly implanted suburbanite .', 'In this wave of revival , many group are marginalized , the reclaimed public space is often sanitized , gentrified and fortified , and not inclusive .', 'However , there are urban public space that defy or at least resist these trend .', 'Examining urban neighbourhood main street reveals that even though the contemporary urban street can never be an unregulated place of unconstrained diversity , there are street that counter the prevalent culture of consumption , and one can find visible sign of spontaneity and diversity of people and activity , and genuine social life .', 'Using research in urban sociology , a taxonomy for sociability is developed , and the existing range of classification of outdoor social activity is expanded .', 'Through empirical examination , this paper explains how these street perform as social spaces—how sociability is enacted , and what is the nature of planning , design and management , which supports social behaviour .', 'Finally , the research emphasizes the role of the street as an ordinary public space in creating affordances for everyday social contact that are crucial to personal well-being and social cohesion .', 'Human Nature , Society and the Home .', "The New Psychology ' , which combines biology , psychology and the social science , is now generating considerable insight and debate .", "Such work gives special emphasis to 'the expressive order ; people 's own understanding and statement deriving from the innate drive affecting their behaviour as well as the socially-constructed culture of which they are part .", 'Housing and urban study , this paper suggests , should be part of these development .', 'Involvement in such issue should , for example , help us address question which have recently been raised in Housing Study by Saunders and Williams .', 'They underlined the fact that the home is of central significance to the life of individual and they suggested that the significance of the home for contemporary social change has been underestimated .', "The intention of the present paper is to suggest that the new synthesis of ethology , sociobiology , social psychology and sociology might be one mean of establishing the home 's wider significance and its centrality to people 's life and identity .", 'This paper concludes by arguing that housing study could make major contribution to this emergent combination of the natural and social science .', 'Enablers and Barrier of Lean Implementation in Construction Projects .', 'Lean aim to maximize customer satisfaction while minimizing waste .', 'However , Lean philosophy has not been well understood yet in the construction industry for the fact that the complexity and dynamic nature of construction project bring up uncertainty that may be hardly handled by construction practitioner .', 'Moreover , project-based nature of construction business makes Lean implementation even more challenging for construction people .', 'Even though Lean effort in construction have recently increased , there are problem with the implementation processes .', 'It is undeniable that successful Lean implementation strongly affects project performance .', 'Therefore , it is essential to reveal enablers and barrier in Lean implementation so that the construction industry practitioner might conduct project more effectively and satisfy project requirement ( i.e .', 'schedule , budget , safety ) .', 'This study aims to provide a set of core enablers and barrier of Lean implementation in construction project and guide construction professional to better satisfy project requirement .', 'Within this context , the study proposes seven major enabler and barrier group , namely the financial , managerial , technical , workforce , culture , government , and communication and twenty-seven component for each group .', 'Moreover , a survey was designed and administered to Lean practitioner to rank the enablers and barrier based on importance level .', 'Clear understanding of technical requirement in Lean practice was ranked as the most important enabler of Lean implementation whereas lack of top management support was ranked as the most important barrier in the Lean implementation .', 'However , the average ranking were not found to be diverging indicating that selected component of enabler and barrier group are properly chosen .', 'The study is expected to lead Lean practitioner with creating value to customer while preventing them from experiencing waste .', 'Demolition on Karl Marx square : Cultural barbarism and the people ’ s state in 1968 .', 'Communist East Germany ’ s demolition of Leipzig ’ s intact medieval University Church in May 1968 was an act widely decried as “ cultural barbarism ” .', 'Although overshadowed by the crackdown on Prague Spring mere week later , the willful destruction of this historic landmark on a central site called Karl Marx Square represents an essential turning point in relation between the Communist authority and the “ people ” they claimed to serve .', 'As the largest case of East German protest between the 1953 Uprising and 1989 Revolution , this intimate local trauma exhibits how the inner working of a “ dictatorial ” system operated more broadly and exposes the often gray and overlapping line between State and citizenry .', 'Through deep analysis of untapped periodical and archive , it introduces a broad cast of character who helped make the demolition possible and restores the voice of ordinary citizen who dared in the name of culture , humanism , and civic pride to protest what they saw as an inconceivable tragedy .', 'In this city that later started the 1989 Revolution triggering the fall of the Berlin Wall , resident from every social background desperately hoped to convince their leader to step back from the brink .', 'But as the dust cleared in 1968 , they saw with all finality that their voice meant nothing , that the DDR was a sham democracy awash with utopian rhetoric that had no connection with their everyday life .', 'If Communism died in Prague in 1968 , it had already died in Leipzig just week before , with repercussion that still haunt today ’ s politics of memory .', 'Below the double bottom line : The challenge of socially sustainable urban water strategy .', 'Recent interview-based research on how Australian urban water professional grasp the social aspect of sustainable water management suggests that interest in these dimension outstrips understanding of them , and that more culturally intelligent , socially realistic and ethically sensitive notion of people , culture and society are needed .', "Despite lip-service to `` triple bottom line '' assessment of policy and development , Australia 's policymakers have advanced no further than a `` double bottom line '' based on economic and environmental value , the latter preferably expressed in dollar term .", 'The economic ( or market relation ) also substitutes for the social dimension in a continued policy emphasis on customer rather than citizen or community member .', "An overemphasis on behavioural economics , a lack of social , political and cultural theory , and neglect of people 's actual practice means that much policy and research around water fails to grapple with such basic social element as gender , different role and access to resource within household , cultural diversity , or ethical orientation .", 'A major challenge is to mobilise rather than ignore the altruistic and socially-oriented human capacity for adapting to change beyond the customer relation or the confines of technical and economic rationality ; including by collective innovation in value and practice of caring for water .', 'Young adult and the decline of the urban English pub : Issue for planning .', "The number of English public house or `` pubs '' have reduced significantly in the last two decade .", 'Politician have called on the planning system to resist their closure but , at the same time , demand further controls over high-street bar .', "This paper explores the reason for the decline and the rationale for supporting the continuation of the `` traditional '' English pub .", "Using evidence drawn from a wider study of the relationship between place and youth drinking culture , the paper discusses young adult ' use of pub .", 'While recognising the adverse effect of heavy drinking , argument are put forward in support of the traditional pub as a site for restrained and responsible social interaction for young adult .', 'The paper discusses the issue this raises for the UK planning system in the context of responsibility for social sustainability and public health .', 'Conflict Activity in the Neighborhoods of Quebec City ( Canada ) , 1989-2000 .', 'This research focuses on the analysis of the spatial distribution of 149 urban conflict occurring between 1989 and 2000 in Quebec City , Canada .', 'Specifically , the article explores the relationship between the spatial dynamic of the conflicts-in term of frequency , duration , and intensity-and the following four dimension of urban space : social composition ; built environment ; propensity to associate and to voice ; and accessibility to various urban resource .', 'The result of statistical analysis by mean of a Kruskal-Wallis test and a Mann-Whitney test show , regardless of the dimension considered , to what extent certain area are characterized by frequency , duration , or intensity of the conflict activity .', 'Specifically , the result suggest that the degree of involvement of local people in a conflict varies very much depending on the nature of the social composition .', 'Other finding show a relationship between area with a high propensity to associate and to voice and a conflict activity that is more intense , more frequent , but not necessarily longer .', 'These form of social practice are thus testimony to the existence of know-how , i.e.', ', a culture of conflict activity oriented towards efficiency .', 'Festive City : Multi-Dimensional Perspective .', 'Until recently there has been limited attention paid in urban study to feature that relate to sensory , not material feature , to consumption not production , pleasure not work , and to episodic rather than permanent characteristic .', 'However festival , episodic event lasting a few day , do provide such function .', 'They take people outside their routine behaviours of work , leisure and family , providing joy , excitement and new experience , sometimes linking to historical tradition .', 'Although such event have always been part of the life of the bigger place , new valuation of their utility have led to an enormous growth in such activity in recent decade , both in number within city , and many other urban place , adding to their vitality and often providing major economic return .', 'A review of the variety of festival show that most fall into six main type , linked to temporal or cyclical , religious , political , tradition-heritage , new culture and lifestyle function , although some may overlap the category and others have morphed from one type to another through time .', 'A multidimensional model of the nature of festival based on eight component provides a basis for assessing their varied character and reveals their often contradictory nature and conflicted consequence .', 'Hybrid coordination of city organisation : The rule of people and culture in the shadow of structure .', 'Under far-reaching reform , many city have delegated core task previously delivered by their administration to independent organisation that they formally own , e.g .', 'municipal company , or supervise , e.g .', 'municipal trust fund .', 'The coordination of these ( as we call them ) ‘ domestic ’ city organisation has proven challenging .', 'Extant literature argues that such coordination is achieved through a mix of various hierarchical , market and network mechanism .', 'Yet it is unclear how these mode are combined .', 'Addressing this gap , we ask : How do governance mode interact in the hybrid coordination of domestic city organisation ?', 'Analysing the case of Vienna , where 100 domestic organisation employ about 60,000 people , we find that while cultural mechanism , rooted in the network mode , are predominant , they unfold in the shadow of latent structural mechanism , which are associated with hierarchy and market .', 'In the background , structural mechanism keep cultural coordination effective , while cultural mechanism allow structural coordination to remain ( generally ) hidden .', 'This study aims to contribute to the literature on the governance of public organisation by exploring the relationship between governance mode as well as furthering urban governance study by applying insight from study on the coordination of public organisation to the city context .', 'Welcome city : Refugee in three German city .', 'Since late 2015 , the author have studied the refugee crisis in Europe .', 'In this article , we analyze local factor that are significant for urban planning to include in an integration plan through case study in three city in Germany .', 'We have chosen to study Germany because of the country ’ s touted Willkommen Kultur ( welcome culture ) , which was prompted in large part by Chancellor Angela Merkel ’ s “ Flüchtlinge Willkommen ” ( “ refugee welcome ” ) stance .', 'Now , three year after Chancellor Merkel ’ s declaration to the world , although international and national policy set many parameter for refugee integration , responses to the uncertainty of the situation are fundamentally informed by local contexts .', 'Germany has adopted a policy of distributing refugee to community throughout the country according to the so-called “ Königstein Key ” , which sets quota for each state according to economic capacity .', 'We have selected case study city and a county that are at different scale and region : Borken in Hessen ( 13,500 people ) , Kassel County ( 200,000 ) , and Essen , a larger city ( 600,000 ) .', 'Here we investigate the way in which German citizen and refugee interact and integrate , with a focus on the social-spatial aspect of refugee experience and the impact on urban planning policy , urban morphology , building typology , and pattern language formation .', 'Beyond crisis , we are looking at how refugee can and will try to integrate into their host country , city , and neighborhood and start a new life and how host community respond to refugee arrival .', 'Urban architecture project for housing and work opportunity that help the process of integration are part of this study .', 'Particularly , in this article , we investigate the reality on the ground of the positive Willkommen Kultur and the high expectation and implied promise that were set in 2015 by Chancellor Angela Merkel and German society .', 'Applying social norm to high-fidelity pedestrian and traffic simulation .', 'Smart city are founded on complex interaction among architectural and urban design , sensor , actuator and crowds of people with their device .', 'In this context , simulation becomes essential to study the effect of the technology and to understand how to improve its effectiveness on the social environment .', 'The majority of the current pedestrian and traffic simulation adopt a bird-eye view and are driven by statistical model .', 'While this is enough in many case , e.g .', 'to study traffic flow under common condition assuming average case , it is not appropriate when a higher level of fidelity is required .', 'Simulated people need to show both a plausible behavior and mechanism to coordinate with human participant in a natural way .', 'Much of this coordination happens silently and is driven by social norm , that may vary according to culture and context .', "In this paper , we propose an approach to represent social norm in multi-agent system that enables implicit coordination driven by observation of others ' behavior .", 'This is applied specifically to the case of pedestrian movement .', 'In order to allow for a more effective participation of human in the simulation , our approach does not use central coordinator or coordination protocol , but rather each agent takes its own decision so to make more realistic interaction .', 'A software architecture and initial experimental result are presented and discussed .', "A high-rise vernacular in Singapore 's housing development board housing .", 'Vernacular architecture is commonly believed to be a quaint representation of the history and tradition of a culture , built by average people using traditional technology over a long period of time but in Singapore there are several indication that the Modernist high rise housing and new town have become a new vernacular .', 'The factor that support this point of view are : 1 ) the ubiquity of the high rise and new town way of life ; 2 ) a shared value system and culture within the new town that is shaped by and reflected in the architecture and planning of the new town ; 3 ) the importance of relationship between space in the new town ; 4 ) the ability of the architecture and planning of new town to adapt to change within Singaporean society ; 5 ) the acceptance , legitimacy , and identification of the high-rise way of life by Singaporeans .', 'A vernacular in Singapore based upon high-rise housing and new town profoundly impacts the understanding of vernacular architecture , Modernist planning , and the industrialization of former Third World country in response to the globalism .', 'Structural beauty : A structure-based computational approach to quantifying the beauty of an image .', 'To say that beauty is in the eye of the beholder means that beauty is largely subjective so varies from person to person .', 'While the subjectivity view is commonly held , there is also an objectivity view that seeks to measure beauty or aesthetic in some quantitative manner .', 'Christopher Alexander has long discovered that beauty or coherence highly correlates to the number of subsymmetries or substructure and demonstrated that there is a shared notion of beauty—structural beauty—among people and even different people , regardless of their faith , culture , and ethnicity .', 'This notion of structural beauty arises directly out of living structure or wholeness , a physical and mathematical structure that underlies all space and matter .', 'Based on the concept of living structure , this paper develops an approach for computing the structural beauty or life of an image ( L ) based on the number of automatically derived substructure ( S ) and their inherent hierarchy ( H ) .', 'To verify this approach , we conducted a series of case study applied to eight pair of image including Leonardo da Vinci ’ s Mona Lisa and Jackson Pollock ’ s Blue Poles .', 'We discovered among others that Blue Poles is more structurally beautiful than the Mona Lisa , and traditional building are in general more structurally beautiful than their modernist counterpart .', 'This finding implies that goodness of thing or image is largely a matter of fact rather than an opinion or personal preference as conventionally conceived .', 'The research on structural beauty has deep implication on many discipline , where beauty or aesthetic is a major concern such as image understanding and computer vision , architecture and urban design , humanity and art , neurophysiology , and psychology .', 'Youth culture and identity in northern thailand : Fitting in and sticking out .', 'Youth Culture and Identity in Northern Thailand examines how young people in urban Chiang Mai construct an identity at the intersection of global capitalism , state ideology , and local culture .', 'Drawing on over 15 year of ethnographic research , the book explores the impact of rapid urbanisation and modernisation on contemporary Thai youth , focusing on conspicuous youth subculture , drug use ( especially methamphetamine use ) , and violent youth gang .', 'Anjalee Cohen shows how young Thai people construct a specific youth identity through consumerism and symbolic boundary – in particular through enduring rural/urban distinction .', 'The suggestion is that the formation of subculture and “ deviant ” youth practice , such as drug use and violence , are not necessarily form of resistance against the dominant culture , nor a pathological response to dramatic social change , as typically understood in academic and public discourse .', 'Rather , Cohen argues that such practice are attempt to “ fit in and stick out ” in an anonymous urban environment .', 'This volume is relevant to scholar in Thai Studies , Southeast Asian Studies , Anthropology , Sociology , Urban Studies , and Development Studies , particularly those with an interest in youth , drug , and gang .', 'Governing with conversation culture–conditioning organizational interaction in a digital social movement .', 'Digital platform support form of collective action with varying degree of organizationality–that is , with organization-like attribute such as identity , actorhood , and decision-making .', 'These form include seemingly non-organized online group , which can be easily dismissed as informal chatter .', 'Building on communicative theory of organizing and Luhmann ’ s Theory of Social Systems , we explore the communicative organizationality of a Facebook group related to urban planning .', 'By analyzing private chat log of the group administrator , we explore the group ’ s organizationality and the way in which organizational and interactional communication become intertwined to produce and curate digital political discussion .', 'Our finding illustrate how technological affordances built for moderation also support the strategic organization of discussion to orchestrate political talk .', 'We conceptualize such operation as discursive conditioning of organizational interaction and suggest that political action online can be propelled not only by connecting people , but also by the powerful yet concealed tactic of conditioning public online discussion .', 'Published by Informa UK Limited , trading as Taylor & Francis Group .', 'Of pirate driver and honking horn mobility , authority , and urban planning in late-colonial accra .', 'This article attempts to bridge two literatures—the African history of urban life and the colonial history of urban planning—in order to better understand the politics of African mobility .', 'In doing so , it situates colonial history of urban planning and emerging African culture of auto-mobility within a broader critique of colonial technology and infrastructure .', 'This article argues that the reality of indirect rule—the autonomy of African urban resident and the weakness of colonial authority and infrastruc-ture—raised new question and problem for colonial official who were tasked with turning ideology into policy and practice .', 'In particular , mobility politics allow us to trace the way that “ average ” people negotiated colonial politics within and outside of the formal , elite structure of elected Town Councils , Legislative Assembles , or chieftaincy politics .', 'Within the colonial bureaucracy and the Town Council , African elites negotiated their own prestige and status alongside the interest and demand of the city ’ s lower-and middle-class population .', 'Giving indigenous people a voice .', "The Taiwan Indigenous TV ( TITV ) , the first TV station devoted to the Taiwan 's aboriginal , is performing a vital task to help aborigine to keep their language and culture alive .", "TITV 's news department often offers break story concerning aborigine , while the station also tackles sensitive issue .", 'Program at TITV are diverse , ranging from cooking show featuring traditional recipe from the various tribe , rarely shown on mainstream TV , to segment educating child about their native language and culture , to talk show and interview covering serious issue including the health , economic and educational problem faced by aborigine .', 'TITV regularly invites distinguished aborigine such as respected scholar to speak on air about matter concerning indigenous people , including unemployment , alcoholism , inadequate health care , fading custom and the sense of isolation felt by youth unable to assimilate into mainstream Taiwanese society .']

['Ethnic minority group and the design of public open scape : An inclusive landscape ?', '.', 'People from ethnic minority group have a range of experience of living in Britain , some of which are significantly different from those of white British people .', 'Previous research and case study suggest that the physical environment has a positive or negative role in perception of everyday life .', 'It is argued that landscape have a symbolic dimension , and aspect of landscape can be recognized as familiar or alien , welcoming or excluding .', 'A wide variety of case study in Britain are used to discuss design and management practice that reflect a range of cultural experience .', 'The need for landscape architect and manager to be aware of how place may be interpreted in different way by different ethnic minority group , and to work towards inclusive design , is highlighted .', 'From multiculturalism to multinaturalism : What rule of method for the new socio-scientific experiment ?', '.', 'This article reflects on the traditional distinction between scientific laboratory experimenting on theory and phenomenon and a political outside where non-experts make do with human value , opinion , and passion .', 'Since today all people are engaged in emerging collective experiment on matter as varied as climate , food , landscape , health , urban design , and technical communication as consumer , militant , and citizen , they can all be considered co-researchers .', "Co-researching has consequence for our understanding of nature and demands a renewed attention to `` multinaturalist '' politics .", 'It also question the division of labor between expert and nonexperts .', "The article finishes with a call to `` dis-invent '' modernity so that we `` modern '' can finally become ordinary human again .", 'A city for all citizen : Integrating child and youth from marginalized population into city planning .', 'Socially just , intergenerational urban space should not only accommodate child and adolescent , but engage them as participant in the planning and design of welcoming space .', "With this goal , city agency in Boulder , Colorado , the Boulder Valley School District , the Children , Youth and Environments Center at the University of Colorado , and a number of community organization have been working in partnership to integrate young people 's idea and concern into the redesign of park and civic area and the identification of issue for city planning .", "Underlying their work is a commitment to the Convention on the Rights of the Child and child 's right to active citizenship from a young age .", 'This paper describes approach used to engage with young people and method of participation , and reflects on lesson learned about how to most effectively involve youth from underrepresented population and embed diverse youth voice into the culture of city planning .', 'Space , culture and urban design in late modernism and after .', 'Among the question underlying recent debate about the architecture of the city , two are perhaps more fundamental .', 'The first concerns the legitimacy of architectural practice : can we be assertive about how we should design our city without seeking to enforce social assumption which are ultimately authoritarian ?', 'The second concern architectural theory itself : can we be specific about what architecture does without being reductive about what society is ?', 'This article identifies and criticizes two kind of recent response to these question : the first is to defend an architecture of localism and containment in some new and some old way ; the second is to retreat into relativism , sometimes supported by the assertion that architecture is of limited consequence because society is increasingly independent of space .', 'The article defends the view that we can and must be assertive about the architecture of city in global rather than local term .', 'The experience of genuinely urban environment is about meeting , though not necessarily interacting with , other people , mostly unknown , who can be of recognizably different class , status , race or ethnic origin ; it is also about exploring the strange , and becoming aware of , though not necessarily participating in , other way of life .', '-from Author', 'City and design .', 'City , initially a product of the manufacturing era , have been thoroughly remade in the image of consumer society .', 'Competitive spending among affluent household has intensified the importance of style and design at every scale and design profession have grown in size and importance , reflecting distinctive geography and locating disproportionately in city most intimately connected with global system of key business service .', "Meanwhile , many observer still believe good design can make positive contribution to people 's life .", 'ities and Design explores the complex relationship between design and urban environment .', 'It traces the intellectual root of urban design , presents a critical appraisal of the imprint and effectiveness of design profession in shaping urban environment , examines the role of design in the material culture of contemporary city , and explores the complex linkage among designer , producer and distributor in contemporary city , for example : fashion and graphic design in New York ; architecture , fashion and publishing in London ; furniture , industrial design , interior design and fashion in Milan ; haute couture in Paris and so on .', "This book offers a distinctive social science perspective on the economic and cultural context of design in contemporary city , presenting city themselves as setting for design , design service and the 'affect ' associated with design .", 'From designed space to designer savvy society : The potential of idea competition in willing participation .', 'The design of public space has gained importance as city are increasingly positioned in global flow of people , capital , and idea .', 'These space speak to the culture of a place as much as to the quality of its design , but the implementation of design as an inclusive process is fraught with difficulty .', "This is particularly pertinent in discussion about better way of engaging people with urban design , where there is often a language barrier between those who specialise in spatial manipulation and the broader 'society ' that uses this space .", 'This paper gives an empirical account of how a spatial consciousness can be translated to society through an international design competition .', "The competition method of urban design relies upon promotion and 'eventfulness ' , both of which interpolate the public and contribute towards the generation of a deeper interest in the spatial imaginary of city planning .", "The creation of 'urban design consumer ' through the visual consumption of the design themselves offers an alternative way to gain public interest to the established tradition of public notice and formal public meeting .", "In this case , the competition extended the activity of urban designer beyond the mechanic of 'space production ' to include 'consumer production ' where a more intimate relationship between city planning and the people began to emerge .", '‘ Mentally , we ’ re rather country people ’ –planssplaining the quest for urbanity in Helsinki , Finland .', 'This paper explores the concept of urbanity in a specific context , namely Helsinki , Finland .', 'In a European context , Finland urbanized late .', 'This lies at the heart of the common interpretation that Finland lacks an urban culture and urban lifestyle .', 'Today , however , with the new comprehensive Urban Plan , city planner in Helsinki emphasize a paradigm shift towards urbanity .', 'This paper seeks to understand this changing emphasis in planning by exploring how planner frame and understand urbanity .', 'The paper concludes that within the Nordic welfare context more emphasis is needed to rethink whom urbanity serf and how it resonates with the prevention of segregation that the city also aims at .']

['Assessing the sustainability of Spanish city considering environmental and socio-economic indicator .', 'The conception of urban metabolism has considered the perspective of environmental sustainability in the framework of city .', 'In this context , city can be regarded complex entity driven by material and energy flow that entail consumption of resource and production of waste material in the pursuit of economic welfare and social progress .', 'According to a sustainability perspective , environmental , social and economic indicator must also be integrated into urban planning process .', 'However , methodological advance regarding the definition and development of sustainable city are required since a consensus of indicator , weighting and data management is still lacking .', 'In this paper , a multi-criteria approach that combine three methodology : Material Flow Analysis ( MFA ) , Life Cycle Assessment ( LCA ) and Data Envelopment Analysis ( DEA ) has been developed and applied to a sample of 26 representative Spanish city with different characteristic ( i.e.', ', population , location , demands , economy , topography and culture ) .', 'The combined approach allows identifying the non-sustainable city considering an offset of indicator from the three pillar of sustainability .', 'With this purpose , the mentioned item are implemented in a DEA model of efficiency , being the inefficient city with an efficiency score lower than 100 % defined as non-sustainable one .', 'Finally , this multi-criteria method allows setting the target value for the assessed indicator ( benchmarked value ) , which become objective for the non-sustainable city to evolve toward a more sustainable performance .', 'The outcome from the analysis have identified six city that ranked worse , with efficiency score ranging from 57.9 % to 85.8 % .', 'According to the target of socio-economic indicator , attention should be paid to AROPE rate ( people at risk of poverty and social exclusion ) , unemployment rate and number of crime , meanwhile lower level of electricity consumption , municipal solid waste and on-site greenhouse gas emission are desirable from an environmental perspective .', 'These outcome are of potential interest for politician , government and inhabitant to aid in the identification of the metabolic flow and social/economic indicator to be optimized in search of sustainability .', 'Factor affecting compliance with residential standard in the city of Old Salt , Jordan .', 'The aim of this paper is to examine the factor which impact on the extent to which urban housing complies with residential standard in the city of Old Salt based in Jordan .', 'The research found that the level of compliance with residential standard is quite low and can vary from one standard to another and from one house to another due to difference in the socio-economic characteristic among people .', 'The finding of multiple regression analysis reveal that there is a good level of public awareness of residential standard , but this does not result in complete compliance with residential standard .', 'Factor , such as household income per month , household size , finance facility , municipal administration culture , monitoring , enforcement and the uncertainty of residential standard have a significant impact on the extent of compliance with planning standard .', 'Suggestion for improved urban planning practice which address these issue are summarised in the paper and include reassessed current residential standard through comprehensive legal framework , linking residential standard with urban design approach , changing planning practice , developing information system to produce effective monitoring system of construction process and enforcement mechanism , the development of local staff including planner , designer and environmental engineer , supported partnership between private and public sector , and the use of participatory planning and citizen involvement .', 'Aquatic system and water security in the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City .', 'In megacities water quantity and quality are threatened by complex and interrelated process caused by population growth , land use change , unsustainable agricultural practice , deforestation , erosion , destruction of ecosystem , lack of planning , laissez-faire policy , unsustainable water management , political conflict , and increasingly also by the impact of climate change .', 'In the Metropolitan Valley of Mexico City ( MVMC ) located in the high plateau of Mexico City and on former lake , the dry out policy during the last 300 year have been counterproductive , causing scarcity , pollution , health and environmental problem , subsidence and water conflict , particularly affecting social vulnerable people .', 'Megacities require an integrated management of water and aquatic system .', '- integral water resource management , rainwater harvesting , maintenance and replacement of infrastructure , restoration of ecosystem and urban planning .', 'This implies investment and a water culture including a transparent administration and peaceful negotiation of conflict regarding concession , access , and reuse of water allocation .', 'Socio-political and environmental process are complex ; besides technical factor and ecosystem recovery , socio-cultural change must transform human settlement and power structure .', 'Community of trust : A socio-cultural approach for community planning and the case of Gaza .', 'This paper defines Community of Trust as socio-spatial setting in which there are substantial trust relationship among people and where they feel defended ( safe ) from internal risk .', 'Our scheme suggests five category of condition that together create Community of Trust : Shared place , shared daily-life practice , shared basic beliefs , and shared perception of community interest and risk .', 'This scheme was examined in five community in Gaza city .', "Data were collected first by informal talk with resident and local decision-makers and then by mean of 973 personal interview in resident ' home .", 'Undoubtedly , the human condition of the people of Gaza are among the worst in the world .', 'Living condition in the city have been difficult for the past century due to a number of factor , including : wave of incoming Palestinian refugee of the War of 1948 , and decade of Israeli occupation .', "In spite of difficult housing condition , poor service and the pressure of lasting internal risk , this study found livable community and strong trust relationship among people of Gaza 's community .", 'This article explains this by the high level of agreement on basic beliefs , the shared daily-life practice , the strong shared perception towards external risk and a few common interest , which were found within each studied area .', 'The last part of the paper is related to the issue of generalizing from the case of homogeneous urban community in Gaza to the frequently heterogeneous community of Western city .', 'This study concludes that trust relationship are the corner-stone upon which community are based anywhere in the world .', 'Hence , in order to sustain community , planner should support trust relationship among resident .', 'This requires culture-sensitive planning .', 'What is the urban without physical mobility ?', 'COVID-19-induced immobility in the mobile risk society .', 'Since the World Health Organization ’ s ( WHO ) declared the Coronavirus outbreak a global pandemic , the virus has invaded life around the globe .', 'The ongoing health , social and economic crisis that followed forced urban life , business , culture , community etc .', 'into idle mode for week resulting from mandated immobility .', 'What was once taken for granted as the essence of urban experience such as cultural activity , meeting friend , relative and colleague in public space or in professional encounter , disappeared overnight .', 'Free movement became significantly restricted all over the world .', 'It seemed that immobility , social and physical distancing , and isolation were the only antidote to the fast-moving virus .', 'For many people , working from home while also schooling their child and providing social care at a distance , peak activity at maximum physical immobility became the “ new normal.', '” A culture emerged where rule and norm of mobility previously taken for granted were re-negotiated and re-defined .', 'Before the crisis and despite the negative ecological side effect , mobility has been positively connotated as a signifier for progress and success .', 'Under the Corona regime mobility turned into a life-threatening risk .', 'The theory of reflexive modernization , risk society and the mobility paradigm are used to discuss these contemporary shift and transformation .', 'Sustainability achievement and estidama green building regulation in Abu Dhabi vision 2030 .', 'Abu Dhabi is the capital of the UAE country and one of seven city that composed the United Arab Emiratis .', "Abu Dhabi has a master plan for the future of the city in economic development `` capital 2030 '' under the name of Abu Dhabi economic vision 2030 and the ( Abu Dhabi Urban Planning Vision 2030 ) .Abu Dhabi Urban planning cancel ( UPC ) drive and support Abu Dhabi urban development strategy and transferring the vision 2030 physical setting and develops strategic development plan that create the guide principle that cascade over critical project designed to shape the Emirate by a sustainable program under the name of `` Estidama '' .", 'Estidama the Arabic world of sustainability is not only a rating method or something that people do , it ` s a vision to achieve a new sustainable way of life in the UAE and Arab region .', 'Estidama goal is to preserve and enrich Abu Dhabi physical and cultural identity and improving quality of live for resident in four equal pillar of sustainability : environment , economic , social and culture .', 'The plan of Estidama in green building incorporates environmental consideration into every stage of building construction and focus on design , construction , operation and maintenance phase .', 'The aim of this paper is to review the Estidama pearl rating system ( PRS ) and to reveal how the green building system is suitable to develop and help the plan of Abu Dhabi ( 2030 vision ) .', 'It ` s concluded that Estidama practice is an efficient tool in establishing the performance of residential building in the city of Abu Dhabi .', 'Currently the research field focus on developing a comfortable and energy efficient residential building design and also with construction sector through developing a building for the new generation .', 'Using decision support system to enable crowd identify neighborhood issue and its solution for policy maker : An online experiment at kabul municipal level .', 'Planning a city is a systematic process that includes time , space , and group of people who must communicate .', 'However , due to security problem in such war-ravaged country as Afghanistan , the traditional form of public participation in the planning process are untenable .', 'In particular , due to gathering space difficulty and culture issue in Afghanistan , woman and religious minority are restricted from joining male-dominated powerholders ’ face-to-face meeting which are nearly always held in fixed place called masjid ( religious building ) .', 'Furthermore , conducting such discussion with human facilitation biases the generation of citizen decision that stimulates an atmosphere of confrontation , causing another decision problem for urban policy-making institution .', 'Therefore , it is critical to find approach that not only securely revolutionize participative process but also provide meaningful and equal public consultation to support interaction among stakehold-ers to solve their shared problem together .', 'Toward this end , we propose a joint research program , namely , crowd-based communicative and deliberative e-planning ( CCDP ) , a blended approach , which is a mixture of using an artificial-intelligence-led technology , decision-support system called D-Agree and experimental participatory planning in Kabul , Afghanistan .', 'For the sake of real-world implementation , Nagoya Institute of Technology ( Japan ) and Kabul Municipality ( Afghanistan ) have formed a novel developed and developing world partnership by using our proposed methodology as an emerging-deliberation mechanism to reframe public participation in urban planning process .', 'In the proposed program , Kabul municipality agreed to use our methodology when Kabul city needs to make a plan with people .', 'This digital field study presents the first practical example of using online decision support system in the context of the neighborhood function of Gozars , which are Kabul ’ s social and spatial urban unit .', 'The main objective was to harness the wisdom of the crowd to innovative suggestion for helping policymakers making strategic development plan for Gozars using open call idea , and for responding to equal participation and consultation need , specifically for woman and minority .', 'This article presents valuable insight into the benefit of this combined approach as blended experience for society and city that are suffering long-term distress .', 'This initiative has influenced other local Afghan government , including the city of Kandahar and Herat as well as the country ’ s central government ’ s ministry of urban planning and land , which has officially expressed its intention to collaborate with us .', 'Post-pandemic city : Historical context for new urban design .', 'City have been almost completely unpre-pared for the COVID-19 pandemic .', 'Urban history has known many epidemic and pandemic , and there are clear historical parallel between the 13th and 19th century plague pandemic and cholera epidemic and the 21th century COVID-19 pandem-ic , from an administrative point of view .', 'However , the city ’ public administration did not take into account the experience of the city of the past to be prepared for the future problem .', 'This requires developing flexible pandemic strategy and focus-ing on the decentralization of urban space through an even distribution of population in the urban en-vironment .', 'The COVID-19 pandemic will change the city , as previous pandemic and epidemic did .', 'Urban-ism v.3.0 .', 'will emerge , combining a green vector of development and digital technology to ensure the autonomy and sustainability of building , dis-tricts and city .', 'At the same time , the role of culture will increase , which will become an effective tool for consolidating the soft power of the city in order to attract new people as the opposition of nowadays trend for living in the countryside .']
